posts.name: Johannes Lade
posts.cooked: I would like to increase the spacing in between lines of text. How do I do that?
posts.raw: I would like to increase the spacing in between lines of text. How do I do that?

posts.cooked: This is called the paragraph “leading”. You can do #set par(leading: ...) to change it. You might also want to adjust the spacing between paragraphs, currently this is done with show par: set block(spacing: ...) but in typst 0.12 it will be simply set par(spacing: ...).
posts.raw: This is called the paragraph "leading". You can do `#set par(leading: ...)` to change it. You might also want to adjust the spacing between paragraphs, currently this is done with `show par: set block(spacing: ...)` but in typst 0.12 it will be simply `set par(spacing: ...)`.

posts.name: Johannes Lade
posts.cooked: But this changes the spacing for all text, also in headings. Can I just change it for flow text?
posts.raw: But this changes the spacing for all text, also in headings. Can I just change it for flow text?

posts.cooked: You mean for headings that extend to several lines? I think to avoid that, you’ll need to add a second rule to override the setting just for heading: #show heading: set par(leading: ...)
posts.raw: You mean for headings that extend to several lines? I think to avoid that, you'll need to add a second rule to override the setting just for heading: `#show heading: set par(leading: ...)`

posts.name: Eike Schulte
posts.cooked: And just to add it here: The default leading is 0.65em. (You will need this value to reset it for headings.)
posts.raw: And just to add it here: The default leading is 0.65em. (You will need this value to reset it for headings.)
